oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Comparison Of African And Australian Grass Finches
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Immelmann, Klauss
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Weaver-Finches, or Grass Finchesare a group of small, seed-eating Passeresbeing distributed over most of Africa,Southern Asia, and the Australian region.For some time, they have been considereda subfamily (Estrildinae) of the trueWeavers (Ploceidae) (cf Delacour 1943,Morris 1958 a.o.). Because, however, ofgreat differences in anatomy, physiology,and behavior most recent workers are ofthe opinion that the Grass Finches constitutea separate family, the Estrildidaeor Spermestidae (Beecher 1953; Steiner1955, 1960; Wolters 1957; Immelmann1962 a.o.).
